org.sindice.siren.index

Interface PositionsIterator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConstrainedNodesEnum, DocsNodesAndPositionsEnum, IntervalConstrainedNodesEnum, LevelConstrainedNodesEnum, MappingMultiDocsNodesAndPositionsEnum, MultiDocsNodesAndPositionsEnum, SingleIntervalConstrainedNodesEnum

    public interface PositionsIterator
    This interface defines methods to iterate over a set of increasing positions.

    This class iterates on positions. The sentinel value NO_MORE_POS (which is set to 2147483647) is used to indicate the end of the position stream.

    To be used in conjunction with DocsAndNodesIterator.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int NO_MORE_POS
      When returned by pos() it means there are no more positions in the iterator.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean nextPosition()
      Move to the next position in the current node matching the query.
      int pos()
      Returns the following: -1 or NO_MORE_POS if nextPosition() were not called yet.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_MORE_POS

        static final int NO_MORE_POS
        When returned by pos() it means there are no more positions in the iterator.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • nextPosition

        boolean nextPosition()
                     throws IOException
        Move to the next position in the current node matching the query.

        Should not be called until DocsAndNodesIterator.nextNode() or DocsAndNodesIterator#skipTo(int, int) are called for the first time.

        Returns:
        false if there is no more position for the current node or if DocsAndNodesIterator.nextNode() or DocsAndNodesIterator#skipTo(int, int) were not called yet.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • pos

        int pos()
        Returns the following:
        • -1 or NO_MORE_POS if nextPosition() were not called yet.
        • NO_MORE_POS if the iterator has exhausted.
        • Otherwise it should return the position it is currently on.
